cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 120 mi SE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west on Thursday, then turning west-northwest Friday and northwest by early Saturday toward the Louisiana coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast between the Mouth of the Mississippi River and Intracoastal City (near/just west of Morgan City)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch, Tropical Storm Watch, Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA; Tropical Storm Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River northward to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Watch: Mouth of the Pearl River to Intracoastal City
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast, especially southeast and south-central Louisiana and adjacent Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) possible at the port by early Friday, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts Friday night into Saturday if intensification occurs.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft inundation above ground level possible in and around Plaquemines Parish, especially during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible, leading to significant flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous currents, possible river/levee overtopping, debris in navigation channels, and reduced visibility.
